#Text=American nun murdered in Brazil
#Text=Tuesday , February 15 , 2005
#Text=ANAPU , Pará , Brazil — Gunmen murdered an American Catholic nun , Sister Dorothy Stang , 73 , in Pará , Brazil .
#Text=The crime occurred Saturday , Feb. 12 , at 9:00 a.m. Her attackers shot Stang six times : once in the head , three times in the back , while she was carrying a Bible .
#Text=Another shot , at her neck , was fatal .
#Text=The crime occurred in Anapu , Pará , inside the Amazon region .
#Text=Stang is from Ohio , United States .
#Text=She had been living in Pará for about 38 years .
#Text=She came to Brazil in 1966 .
#Text=She is a member of the Catholic group Sisters of Notre Dame de Namur .
#Text=She was an activist and had been working at the region of Anapu .
#Text=Earlier this year , the missionary received an " Honorary Citizenship of the State " from the state of Para .
#Text=Stang had been defending the Projeto de Desenvolvimento Sustentado(Project of Supported Development ) or PDS for short .
#Text=The Trans-Amazon development project was designed to generate jobs and income in Anapu .
#Text=It supported the creation of an fruit processing industry , the construction of two small 500 kilowatt hydroelectric powerplants , and aided reforestation in degraded areas .
#Text=According to Reuters , loggers , ranchers , and large farmers have been strong opponents of the project and of Stang .
#Text=Stang has already received death threats several times before .
#Text=In March 2004 , she asked for help from Brazilian Federal authorities , saying she and other persons were on a death list .
#Text=On another occasion , in August 2004 , she said , " It is not my safety but that of the people that really matters .

column1: #Text=She said other people will die if the Brazilian government does not start good political development of the region .
#Text=She hopes the current actions by the government after the murderer of sister Dorothy will not be temporary .
